body: Don't dance on a volcano.
author: Unknown

body: The frog does not drink up the pond in which it lives.
author: Proverb

body: Love is energy of life.
author: Robert Browning

body: The scythe ran into a stone.
author: Proverb

body: Every cloud engenders not a storm.
author: William Shakespeare

body: We learn not for school, but for life.
author: Proverb

body: Bless my weeds.
author: Proverb

body: Don't put all your eggs in one basket.
author: Proverb

body: Support bacteria; it is the only culture we have left.
author: Bumper sticker

body: A bird does not sing because it has an answer.
author: Proverb

body: We all have a dinosaur deep within us just trying to get out.
author: Colin Mochrie

body: If man makes himself a worm he must not complain when he is trodden on.
author: Immanuel Kant

body: Change is the constant, the signal for rebirth, the egg of the phoenix.
author: Christina Baldwin

body: Never trust anything you can eat.
author: Old dragon proverb

body: I am ashes where once I was fire.
author: Lord George Gordon Byron

body: I'd rather be eaten by a dragon.
author: Famous Last Words

body: An unhatched egg is to me the greatest challenge in life.
author: E. B. White

body: Water which is too pure has no fish.
author: Ts'ai Ken T'an

body: Save the whales. Collect the whole set.
author: Unknown

body: Float like a butterfly, sting like a bee.
author: Muhammad Ali

body: Steel loses much of its value when it loses its temper.
author: Unknown

body: It's hard to remember the goal to drain the swamp when we are up to our waist in alligators.
author: Unknown

body: If it weren't for electricity we'd all be watching television by candlelight.
author: George Gobel

body: Love and eggs are best when they are fresh.
author: Proverb

body: One cannot collect all the beautiful shells on the beach.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

body: Lisa, vampires are make-believe, like elves, gremlins, and eskimos.
author: Homer Simpson

body: Ashes to ashes dust to dust.
author: Proverb

body: Genius has no taste for weaving sand.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

body: We boil at different degrees.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

body: Or shear swine, all cry and no wool.
author: Samuel Butler

body: Live fast, die young, make a pretty corpse.
author: Richard Wright

body: A great flame follows a little spark.
author: Dante Alighieri

body: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
author: William Butler Yeats

body: It's not poisonous...
author: Famous Last Words

body: The most beautiful fig may contain a worm.
author: Proverb

body: Dishonor will not trouble me, once I am dead.
author: Euripides

body: You can't make an omelet without breaking eggs.
author: Proverb

body: Don't climb a tree to look for fish.
author: Proverb

body: I've never seen electricity, that's why I don't pay for it.
author: Steven Wright

body: Behold the turtle. He makes progress only when he sticks his neck out.
author: James B. Conant

body: If a person lacks problems he will invent them.
author: Unknown

body: Peace and a well-built house cannot be bought too dearly.
author: Proverb

body: A bad workman quarrels with his tools.
author: Proverb

body: Rotten wood cannot be carved.
author: Proverb

body: The wheel that squeks the loudest is the first to be replaced.
author: Unknown

body: Don't put the cart before the horse.
author: Proverb

body: If God had meant for us to fly, he wouldn't have given us railways.
author: Unknown

body: Plow deep while sluggarrds sleep.
author: Unknown

body: Imagination is the one weapon in the war against reality..
author: Jules de Gaultier

body: Like a dog, he hunts in dreams.
author: Lord Alfred Tennyson

body: Magic users are WIMPS!
author: Famous Last Words

body: I war not with the dead.
author: Homer

body: The squeky wheel gets the grease.
author: Proverb

body: To be proud of virtue is to poison oneself with the antidote.
author: Benjamin Franklin

body: Smooth speech has its own poison.
author: Proverb

body: Let a man avoid evil deeds as a man who loves life avoids poison.
author: Guatama Buddha

body: We all know that small cars are good for us. But so is cod liver oil. And jogging.
author: Jeremy Clarkson

body: You have to separate the chaff from the wheat.
author: Proverb

body: Am I seeing things or is that a dragon?
author: Famous Last Words

body: Hey, I know a dragon when I see one.
author: Famous Last Words

body: The world needs more heroes.
author: Unknown

body: Everyone is kneaded out of the same dough but not baked in the same oven.
author: Proverb

body: He who lives by the crystal ball soon learns to eat ground glass.
author: Edgar R. Fiedler

body: Volcano: A mountain with hiccups.
author: Unknown

body: A team effort is a lot of people doing what I say.
author: Michael Winner

body: Shut your mouth, you mediocre clarinet player.
author: Plankton

body: A rolling stone gathers no moss.
author: Proverb

body: Even snakes are afraid of snakes.
author: Steven Wright

body: I can't make bricks without clay.
author: Sherlock Holmes

body: Life is a cement trampoline.
author: Howard Nordberg

body: Clearly, then, the city is not a concrete jungle, it is a human zoo.
author: Desmond Morris

body: Ask about your neighbors, then buy the house.
author: Proverb

body: All the tools and engines on earth are only extensions of man's limbs and senses.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

body: It's not rocket science.
author: Proverb

body: I thought clay must feel happy in the good potter's hand.
author: Janet Fitch

body: Concrete is, essentially, the color of bad weather.
author: William Hamilton

body: Do not seek storms. They will find you.
author: Sterling G. Ellsworth

body: I was once stalked by a treant... he just wouldn't leaf.
author: Unknown

body: Assassination is the extreme form of censorship.
author: George Bernard Shaw

body: Grass doesn't grow on a busy street.
author: Proverb

body: Without craftmanship, inspiration is a mere reed shaken in the wind.
author: Johannes Brahms

body: Adversity's sweet milk, philosophy.
author: William Shakespeare

body: Better a mouse in the pot than no meat at all.
author: Proverb

body: I tell you the past is a bucket of ashes.
author: Carl Sandburg

body: Smooth seas do not make skillful sailors.
author: Proverb

body: You are not wood, you are not stones, but men.
author: William Shakespeare

body: A verbal contract isn't worth the paper it's written on.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

body: A man is himself-plus the books he reads.
author: Proverb

body: What gunpowder did for war the printing press has done for the mind.
author: Wendell Phillips

body: Remember the first rule of gunfighting... 'Have a gun.'
author: Jeff Cooper

body: If Dracula can't see his reflection in the mirror, how come his hair is always so neatly combed?
author: Steven Wright

body: Once we start re-entering the atmosphere, you start seeing the plasma go by the windows.
author: James Kelly

body: A fool looks for dung where the cow never browsed.
author: Proverb

body: All sins are attempts to fill voids.
author: Simone Weil

body: A peck of March dust is worth a king's ransom.
author: Proverb

body: The storm also beats on the house that is built on the rock.
author: Unknown

body: Plasmas are by far the most common phase of matter in the universe, both by mass and by volume.
author: D. A. Gurnett

body: Footprints on the sands of time are never made by sitting down.
author: Proverb

body: No man ever wetted clay and then left it, as if there would be bricks by chance and fortune.
author: Plutarch

body: Theory attracts practice as the magnet attracts iron.
author: Karl Friedrich Gauss

body: Am I talking to a brick wall.
author: Proverb

body: In every failure lies the seeds of success.
author: Dr. Deepak Chopra

body: All the thoughts of a turtle are turtles, and of a rabbit, rabbits.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

body: Sweet flowers are slow and weeds make haste.
author: William Shakespeare

body: All mushrooms are edible - once.
author: Unknown

body: Diamonds are only chunks of coal that stuck to their jobs, you see.
author: Minnie Richard Smith

body: I knew a phoenix in my youth, so let them have their day.
author: William Butler Yeats

body: Wisdom is the daughter of experience.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

body: In shallow waters, shrimps make fools of dragons.
author: Proverb

body: When you see a palm tree, the palm tree has seen you.
author: Proverb

body: There are times when one would like to hang the whole human race, and finish the farce.
author: Mark Twain

body: Sex is part of nature. I go along with nature.
author: Marilyn Monroe

body: At least, lightning never strikes twice...
author: Famouse Last Words

body: If the only tool you have is a hammer, you tend to see every problem as a nail.
author: Abraham H. Maslow

body: The search for a scapegoat is the easiest of all hunting expeditions.
author: Unknown

body: Can my sword talk to your axe?
author: Famous Last Words

body: A book, tight shut, is but a block of paper.
author: Proverb

body: It is not only fine feathers that make fine birds.
author: Aesop

body: A closed mind is like a closed book: just a block of wood.
author: Proverb

body: One who knows books has four eyes.
author: Proverb

body: If you want to catch more fish, use more hooks.
author: Gracie Allen

body: Throw out a herring to catch a whale.
author: Proverb

body: I got food poisoning today. I don't know when I'll use it.
author: Steven Wright

body: Try to be like the turtle - at ease in your own shell.
author: William Taylor Copeland

body: The dog is the only animal that has seen his god.
author: Unknown

body: Never moon a werewolf.
author: Mike Binder

body: A house is a machine for living in.
author: Le Corbusier

body: Sacred cows make the best hamburger.
author: Mark Twain

body: Nature abhors a vacuum.
author: Francois Rabelais

body: Patience is what you require when the fish are not hungry.
author: Unknown

body: Airplane travel is nature's way of making you look like your passport photo.
author: Al Gore

body: Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence in society.
author: Mark Twain

body: Most people give off as much heat as a 100 watt bulb, but not as much light.
author: Unknown

body: It's not true I had nothing on, I had the radio on.
author: Marilyn Monroe

body: The mind is like a TV set - when it goes blank, it's a good idea to turn off the sound.
author: Unknown

body: Computers are stupid - they do exactly what you tell them to do.
author: Unknown

body: The telephone is a good way to talk to people without having to offer them a drink.
author: Fran Lebowitz

body: Some painters transform the sun into a yellow spot, others transform a yellow spot into the sun.
author: Pablo Picasso

body: We will never be an advanced civilization as long as rain showers can delay the launching of a space rocket.
author: George Carlin

body: A satellite has no conscience.
author: Edward R. Murrow

body: When lasers were invented in 1960, they were called "a solution looking for a problem."
author: Charles H. Townes

body: Silence is golden when you can't think of a good answer.
author: Unknown

body: Beneath the warm, fuzzy exterior beats the cold, mechanical heart of a robot.
author: Futurama

body: Well, the future of the Internet is... reality.
author: Daniel Keys Moran

body: There seems to be a law that governs all our actions so I never make plans.
author: Greta Garbo

body: If you hold a cat by the tail you learn things you cannot learn any other way.
author: Mark Twain

body: The irreversibility of time is the mechanism that brings order out of chaos.
author: Unknown

body: For whoever is lonely there is a tavern.
author: Georg Trakl

body: An alarm clock is a device that makes you rise and whine.
author: Unknown

body: A smile is a powerful weapon; you can even break ice with it.
author: Unknown

body: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
author: Socrates

body: Money is not the most important thing in the world. Love is. Fortunately, I love money.
author: Unknown

body: What happens to the hole when the cheese is gone?
author: Bertolt Brecht

body: The ant is knowing and wise, but he doesn't know enough to take a vacation.
author: Clarence Day

body: Leave the atom alone.
author: E. Y. Harburg

body: When someone asks if you'd like cake or pie, why not say you want cake and pie?
author: Lisa Loeb

body: Relax, the handcuffs are tight because they're new. They stretch after awhile.
author: Unknown

body: Age does not diminish the extreme disappointment of having a scoop of ice cream fall from the cone.
author: Jim Fiebig

body: Always laugh when you can. It is cheap medicine.
author: Lord George Gordon Byron

body: The only time to eat diet food is while you're waiting for the steak to cook.
author: Julia Child

body: When my horse is running good, I don't stop to give him sugar.
author: William Faulkner

body: I may be able to spot arrowheads on the desert but a refrigerator is a jungle in which I am easily lost.
author: Edward T. Hall

body: If you obey all the rules you miss all the fun.
author: Katharine Hepburn

body: Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.
author: Victor Hugo

body: That's one small step for a man, a giant leap for mankind.
author: Neil Armstrong

body: The trouble with being a hypochondriac these days is that antibiotics have cured all the good diseases.
author: Caskie Stinnett

body: Most rock journalism is people who can't write, interviewing people who can't talk, for people who can't read.
author: Frank Zappa

body: A bank is a place that will lend you money if you can prove that you don't need it.
author: Bob Hope

body: The really important things are said over cocktails and are never done.
author: Peter F. Drucker

body: Talents wins games, but teamwork and intelligence wins championships.
author: Michael Jordan

body: All you need is love: and cookies.
author: Unknown

body: The debt we owe to the play of imagination is incalculable.
author: Carl Jung

body: Modern man drives a mortgaged car over a bond-financed highway on credit-card gas.
author: Earl Wilson

body: Think of war as a game of Russian roulette. It is a game of chance with your life as the grand prize.
author: Ramman Kenoun

body: To a journalist, good news is often not news at all.
author: Phil Donahue

body: I love playing an alien.
author: Sigourney Weaver

body: When the mouse laughs at the cat there is a hole nearby.
author: Nigerian Proverb

body: When life gives you lemons, make life take the lemons back!
author: Cave Johnson

body:
if (about_to_crash)
    dont();
author: Drone AI

body: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world: the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
author: George Bernard Shaw

body: When you do things right, people won’t be sure you’ve done anything at all.
author: Futurama
